intro: Galium degenii, commonly known as Degen's bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium degenii is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves.
